newsitem.title: USA: Genta to split into two companies.
newsitem.headline: Genta to split into two companies.

text.p: Genta Inc said on Tuesday it plans to split into a focused drug delivery company and a separately funded company to develop a treatment to inhibit tumor growth in cancer patients.
Genta said it is working with Forward Ventures, a San Diego-based venture capital firm, to seek funding for the new cancer company, which will work with Genta's proprietary Anticode technology.
Genta said it plans to have significant ownership interest in the cancer company.
Genta said nine employees have been fired, effective October 16, but it intends to offer all nine employment in the new cancer company when it is formed.
Genta said it will downsize its European operation, and its dermatology business will be sold. It also plans to sell its JBL unit.
Genta said it is in negotiations with a potential buyer of JBL. Proceeds from any sale will be used for Genta's restructuring.
The restructuring has included a reduction in general and administrative functions, Genta said, and its chief financial officer has resigned.
Genta said it is seeking additional capital to strengthen its balance sheet and to cover certain expenses.
